We welcome your feedback, suggestions and ideas to help us to make changes to improve your services.

Business travel account services

  • With one phone call, fax or email, you can book all your tickets, reserve seats and get journey planning advice for the entire National Rail network.
  • Complete itemised journey itinerary with onward connection information and any restrictions that apply.
  • Advice on Standard and 1st Class travel.
  • Immediate confirmation.
  • Seat, sleeper and dining car reservations where available.
  • London Underground Travelcards.
  • Order season tickets for your employees by phone or fax.
  • Tickets sent to you by First Class post, or collect them from our Business Travel Centre at Bicester North Station.
  • All for free, not a penny extra.

BuyingTickets.com:Note: Tickets are not available for purchase on board trains.

com:Annotation.com:Note: Exploring Europe by train is easier than ever before. Come with us to the heart of Europe's most exciting cities across France, Belgium, the Netherlands, Germany and the UK. Forget hanging around at baggage carousels or worrying about weight limits on luggage. This is high-speed, low stress travel.
Web related support available by calling 03448 224 777 (Monday-Friday 08:00-22:00 and Saturday-Sunday 09:00-17:00).

If youre travelling with a disability, non-visible disability or youre elderly, were here to help. In all our stations, we offer free assistance to get you to and from your train. But please pre-book at least 24 hours before departure.
Assistance can also be booked online at https://help.eurostar.com/email?lang=en
You cannot buy tickets via phone for travel between the UK and France, Belgium or the Netherlands.
You cannot buy tickets via phone for travel between the UK and France, Belgium or the Netherlands.
If youre travelling in a group of 10 or more people, weve got a dedicated team who can prepare quotes for you and share lots of tips for a seamless trip.

Eurostar for Business is the travel portal for businesses looking to take control of their corporate travel. Enjoy exclusive partner offers, earn personal points from your business travel, and reduce your carbon footprint.

BuyingTickets.com:Note:
We appreciate that sometimes you will not be able to buy a ticket at the station before you board, due to the ticket office being closed or self-service ticket machines not working. If this happens speak to our onboard staff, who will find out why the problem occurred and issue you with the cheapest available ticket for your journey.

If you board without a ticket where the ticket office was open and/or self-service ticket machines were working, you will be liable to purchase the Anytime Single or Return ticket to complete your journey.

Get a valid ticket before you travel.

You must have a valid ticket of aPermit to Travel for your entire journey before you go, otherwise you could have to pay a Penalty Fare.

This is at least 20 or double the full single fare to the next station stop. Plus the usual single fare to your destination if you continue your journey.

You might also have to pay a Penalty Fare if you:

  • Can't show an appropriate Railcard for a discounted ticket
  • Travel in a First Class carriage with a Standard Class ticket
  • Are travelling on a Child rate ticket but are 16 or over
  • Travel beyond the destination on your ticket.

Tickets are available for purchase on-board our trains only when a journey commences from a station that does not have ticket purchasing facilities or where ticket buying facilities are out of order.

com:Annotation.com:Note: For train times and fares please contact National Rail Enquires on 0845 748 4950 or if your enquire is specific to London Southend Airport Railway Station, please contact our helpdesk 24 hours a day on 0800 032 6294.

BuyingTickets.com:Note:
Where the opportunity to purchase a ticket exists at the station before boarding the train then the passenger must purchase a ticket for their entire journey. If a passenger chooses not to buy their ticket when they have the opportunityto do so and purchases their ticket on the train then they will be charged the full standard open single or return fare, irrespective of the day and time of travel.

Where there is no ticket office or ticket machine then the passenger may purchase a ticket on the train. In these circumstances the passenger will be charged the appropriate fare for the journey that is being undertaken taking into account the day and time of travel.

If you have lost something at a Thameslink station or onboard a Thameslink train, please visit the Thameslink Website and use the webform to register your lost item.

Some Thameslink trains serve stations which are managed by other train operators (see below). You should consider logging your lost item with them, just in case it's been handed in at one of their stations.

  • London North Eastern Railway (LNER)
  • Greater Anglia
  • Transport for London including London Overground
  • Southeastern
  • Southern
  • South Western Railway (for Wimbledon)

If you have found an item of lost property, please hand it in to a member of staff.
Thameslink does not operate a telesales service
Thameslink does not operate a business travel service

BuyingTickets.com:Note:
You must have a valid ticket for your journey before boarding the train. If you fail to do so without an exceptional reason, not only could you miss out on lower-priced and discounted fares, you could also be liable for penalties or even prosecution, with fines of up to 1000 (National Rail Conditions of Travel and Railway Byelaws 2005).

If station ticket purchase facilities are not available, please use our website, app (or payzone, if applicable) or buy your ticket from the conductor on board. Customers 16 years and over must purchase an adult ticket.
Tickets are available for purchase on-board our trains only where a journey has commenced at a stationthat does not have ticket buying facilities or where ticket buying facilities are out of order.
